[He]191-papa repeated those arguments of [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon , not agreeing in [their]382-the archdeacon truth , but explaining [his]191-papa inability to escape from [them]382-the archdeacon ; how it had been declared to [him]191-papa that [he]191-papa was bound to remain where [he]191-papa was by the interests of [his]191-papa order , by gratitude to [the bishop]260-the bishop , by the wishes of [[his]191-papa friends]627-his friends , by a sense of duty , which , though [he]191-papa could not understand it , [he]191-papa was fain to acknowledge . [He]191-papa told [her]3761-her how [he]191-papa had been accused of cowardice , and though [he]191-papa was not [a man to make much of such a charge]3767-a man to make much of such a charge before [the world]325-the world , now in the full candour of [his]191-papa heart , [he]191-papa explained to [her]3761-her that such an accusation was grievous to [him]191-papa ; that [he]191-papa did think it would be unmanly to desert [his]191-papa post , merely to escape [his]191-papa present sufferings , and that , therefore , [he]191-papa must bear as best [he]191-papa might the misery which was prepared for [him]191-papa . And did [she]3761-her find these details tedious ? Oh , no — [she]3761-her encouraged [him]191-papa to dilate on every feeling [he]191-papa expressed , till [he]191-papa laid bare the inmost corners of [his]191-papa heart to [her]3761-her . [They]3769-they spoke together of [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon , as [two children]3771-two children might of [a stern , unpopular , but still respected schoolmaster]3772-a stern , unpopular , but still respected schoolmaster , and of [the bishop]260-the bishop as [a parent kind as kind]3774-a parent kind as kind could be , but powerless against [an omnipotent pedagogue]3775-an omnipotent pedagogue . And then , when [they]3769-they had discussed all this , when [the father]3737-the father had told all to [the child]3777-the child , [she]3761-her could not be less confiding than [he]1274-him had been ; and as [John Bold]121-bold 's name was mentioned between [them]3769-they , [she]3761-her owned how well [she]3761-her had learned to love [him,—"had]121-bold[1275-her] loved [him]1274-him once , " [she]3761-her said , "[1275-her] but [she]1275-her would not , could not do so now — no , even had [her]1275-her troth been plighted to [him]1274-him , [she]1275-her would have taken it back again — had [she]1275-her sworn to love [him]1274-him as [[his]1274-him wife]607-his wife , [she]1275-her would have discarded [him]1274-him and not felt [herself]1275-her forsworn , when [he]1274-him proved [himself]1274-him [the enemy of [[her]1275-her father]293-her father]1277-the enemy of her father . " But [the warden]318-the warden declared that [Bold]121-bold was [no enemy of [his]318-the warden]3779-no enemy of his , and encouraged [her]1275-her love ; and gently rebuked , as [he]1274-him kissed [her]1275-her , the stern resolve [she]1275-her had made to cast [him]1274-him off ; and then [he]1274-him spoke to [her]1275-her of happier days when [their]3780-their trials would all be over ; and declared that [her]1275-her young heart should not be torn asunder to please either [priest]3781-priest or [prelate]3782-prelate , [dean]261-dean or [archdeacon]2734-archdeacon . No , not if [all Oxford]3785-all oxford were to convocate together , and agree as to the necessity of the sacrifice . And so [they]3780-their greatly comforted [each other]497-each other — and in what sorrow will not such mutual confidence give consolation!—and with a last expression of tender love [they]3780-their parted , and went comparatively happy to [[their]3780-their rooms]3787-their rooms . When [Eleanor]104-eleanor laid [her]104-eleanor head on [her]104-eleanor pillow that night , [her]104-eleanor mind was anxiously intent on some plan by which [she]104-eleanor might extricate [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father from [his]293-her father misery ; and , in [her]104-eleanor warm - hearted enthusiasm , self - sacrifice was decided on as the means to be adopted . Was not so good an [Agamemnon]192-agamemnon worthy of an Iphigenia ? [She]104-eleanor would [herself]104-eleanor personally implore [John Bold]121-bold to desist from [his]121-bold undertaking ; [she]104-eleanor would explain to [him]121-bold [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father 's sorrows , the cruel misery of [his]121-bold position ; [she]104-eleanor would tell [him]121-bold how [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father would die if [he]293-her father were thus dragged before [the public]2937-the public and exposed to such unmerited ignominy ; [she]104-eleanor would appeal to [his]121-bold old friendship , to [his]121-bold generosity , to [his]121-bold manliness , to [his]121-bold mercy ; if need were [she]104-eleanor would kneel to [him]121-bold for the favour [she]104-eleanor would ask ; but before [she]104-eleanor did this , the idea of love must be banished . There must be no bargain in the matter . To [his]121-bold mercy , to [his]121-bold generosity , [she]104-eleanor could appeal ; but as [a pure maiden]3792-a pure maiden , hitherto even unsolicited , [she]104-eleanor could not appeal to [his]121-bold love , nor under such circumstances could [she]104-eleanor allow [him]121-bold to do so . Of course when so provoked , [he]121-bold would declare [his]121-bold passion ; that was to be expected ; there had been enough between [them]3793-them to make such a fact sure ; but it was equally certain that [he]121-bold must be rejected . [She]104-eleanor could not be understood as saying , Make [[my]121-bold father]942-my father free and [I]121-bold am the reward . There would be no sacrifice in that — not so had [[Jephthah]193-jephthah 's daughter]3795-jephthah 's daughter saved [[her]3795-jephthah 's daughter father]293-her father — not so could [she]104-eleanor show to [that kindest , dearest of parents]3797-that kindest , dearest of parents how much [she]104-eleanor was able to bear for [his]121-bold good . No ; to one resolve must [her]104-eleanor whole soul be bound ; and so resolving , [she]104-eleanor felt that [she]104-eleanor could make [her]104-eleanor great request to [Bold]121-bold with as much self - assured confidence as [she]104-eleanor could have done to [[his]121-bold grandfather]3798-his grandfather . And now [I]121-bold own [I]121-bold have fears for [[my]121-bold heroine]3799-my heroine : not as to the upshot of [her]3799-my heroine mission — not in the least as to that ; as to the full success of [her]3799-my heroine generous scheme , and the ultimate result of such a project , [no one conversant with human nature and novels]3800-no one conversant with human nature and novels can have a doubt ; but as to the amount of sympathy [she]3799-my heroine may receive from [those of [her]3799-my heroine own sex]3801-those of her own sex . [Girls below twenty]3802-girls below twenty and [old ladies above sixty]3803-old ladies above sixty will do [her]3799-my heroine justice ; for in the female heart the soft springs of sweet romance reopen after many years , and again gush out with waters pure as in earlier days , and greatly refresh the path that leads downwards to the grave . But [I]121-bold fear that [the majority of those between these two eras]3804-the majority of those between these two eras will not approve of [Eleanor]104-eleanor 's plan . [I]121-bold fear that [unmarried ladies of thirty - five]3805-unmarried ladies of thirty - five will declare that there can be no probability of so absurd a project being carried through ; that [young women on [their]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers knees before [[their]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers lovers]3807-their lovers]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers are sure to get kissed , and that [they]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers would not put [themselves]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers in such a position did [they]3806-young women on their knees before their lovers not expect it ; that [Eleanor]104-eleanor is going to Bold , only because circumstances prevent [Bold]121-bold from coming to [her]104-eleanor ; that [she]104-eleanor is certainly [a little fool]3808-a little fool , or [a little schemer]3809-a little schemer , but that in all probability [she]104-eleanor is thinking a good deal more about [herself]104-eleanor than [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father . [Dear ladies]3811-dear ladies , [you]3811-dear ladies are right as to [your]3811-dear ladies appreciation of the circumstances , but very wrong as to [Miss Harding]156-miss harding 's character . [Miss Harding]156-miss harding was much younger than [you]3811-dear ladies are , and could not , therefore , know , as [you]3811-dear ladies may do , to what dangers such an encounter might expose [her]156-miss harding . [She]156-miss harding may get kissed ; [I]121-bold think it very probable that [she]156-miss harding will ; but [I]121-bold give [my]121-bold solemn word and positive assurance , that the remotest idea of such a catastrophe never occurred to [her]156-miss harding , as [she]156-miss harding made the great resolve now alluded to . And then [she]156-miss harding slept ; and then [she]156-miss harding rose refreshed , and met [[her]156-miss harding father]293-her father with [her]156-miss harding kindest embrace and most loving smiles ; and on the whole [their]3813-their breakfast was by no means so triste as had been [their]3813-their dinner the day before ; and then , making some excuse to [[her]156-miss harding father]293-her father for so soon leaving [him]293-her father , [she]156-miss harding started on the commencement of [her]156-miss harding operations . [She]156-miss harding knew that [John Bold]121-bold was in [London]13-london , and that , therefore , the scene itself could not be enacted to - day ; but [she]156-miss harding also knew that [he]121-bold was soon to be [home]3108-home , probably on the next day , and it was necessary that some little plan for meeting [him]121-bold should be concerted with [[his]121-bold sister]536-his sister [Mary]162-mary . When [she]156-miss harding got up to [the house]374-the house , [she]156-miss harding went as usual into [the morning sitting - room]3818-the morning sitting - room , and was startled by perceiving , by a stick , a great coat , and sundry parcels which were lying about , that [Bold]121-bold must already have returned . "[121-bold] [John]121-bold has come back so suddenly , " said [Mary]162-mary , coming into [the room]3355-the room ; "[121-bold] [he]121-bold has been travelling all night . " "[121-bold] Then [I]0-i 'll come up again some other time , " said [Eleanor]104-eleanor , about to beat a retreat in [her]104-eleanor sudden dismay . "[0-i] [He]121-bold 's out now , and will be for the next two hours , " said [the other]762-the other ; "[121-bold] [he]121-bold 's with that horrid [Finney]188-attorney finney ; [he]121-bold only came to see [him]121-bold , and [he]121-bold returns by [the mail train]1279-the mail train to - night . " Returns by [the mail train]1279-the mail train to - night , thought [Eleanor]104-eleanor to [herself]104-eleanor , as [she]104-eleanor strove to screw up [her]104-eleanor courage — away again to - night — then it must be now or never ; and [she]104-eleanor again sat down , having risen to go . [She]104-eleanor wished the ordeal could have been postponed : [she]104-eleanor had fully made up [her]104-eleanor mind to do the deed , but [she]104-eleanor had not made up [her]104-eleanor mind to do it this very day ; and now [she]104-eleanor felt ill at ease , astray , and in difficulty . "[121-bold] [Mary]162-mary , " [she]104-eleanor began , "[162-mary] [I]0-i must see [[your]162-mary brother]1199-your brother before [he]121-bold goes back . " "[162-mary] Oh yes , of course , " said [the other]762-the other ; "[162-mary] [I]0-i know [he]121-bold 'll be delighted to see [you]0-i ; " and [she]104-eleanor tried to treat it as a matter of course , but [she]104-eleanor was not the less surprised ; for [Mary]162-mary and [Eleanor]104-eleanor had daily talked over [John Bold]121-bold and [his]121-bold conduct , and [his]121-bold love , and [Mary]162-mary would insist on calling [Eleanor]104-eleanor [[her]162-mary sister]3823-her sister , and would scold [her]162-mary for not calling [Bold]121-bold by [his]121-bold christian name ; and [Eleanor]104-eleanor would half confess [her]104-eleanor love , but like [a modest maiden]3824-a modest maiden would protest against such familiarities even with the name of [[her]104-eleanor lover]656-her lover : and so [they]3826-they talked hour after hour , and [Mary Bold]162-mary , who was [much the elder]3827-much the elder , looked forward with happy confidence to the day when [Eleanor]104-eleanor would not be ashamed to call [her]162-mary , [[her]162-mary sister]3823-her sister . [She]162-mary was , however , fully sure that just at present [Eleanor]104-eleanor would be much more likely to avoid [[her]104-eleanor brother]528-her brother than to seek [him]1199-your brother . "[121-bold] [Mary]162-mary , [I]0-i must see [[your]162-mary brother]1199-your brother , now , to - day , and beg from [him]1199-your brother a great favour , " and [she]162-mary spoke with a solemn air , not at all usual to [her]162-mary ; and then [she]162-mary went on , and opened to [[her]162-mary friend]3830-her friend all [her]162-mary plan , [her]162-mary well - weighed scheme for saving [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father from a sorrow which would , [she]162-mary said , if it lasted , bring [him]1199-your brother to [his]1199-your brother grave . "[0-i] But [Mary]162-mary , " [she]162-mary continued , "[162-mary] [you]162-mary must now , [you]162-mary know , cease any joking about [me]0-i and [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold ; [you]162-mary must now say no more about that ; [I]0-i am not ashamed to beg this favour from [[your]162-mary brother]1199-your brother , but when [I]0-i have done so , there can never be anything further between [us]1283-us ; " and this [she]162-mary said with a staid and solemn air , quite worthy of [[Jephthah]193-jephthah 's daughter]3795-jephthah 's daughter or of Iphigenia either . It was quite clear that [Mary Bold]162-mary did not follow the argument : that [Eleanor Harding]104-eleanor should appeal , on behalf of [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father , to [Bold]122-mr. bold 's better feelings , seemed to [Mary]162-mary quite natural ; it seemed quite natural that [he]122-mr. bold should relent , overcome by such filial tears , and by so much beauty ; but , to [her]162-mary thinking , it was at any rate equally natural , that having relented , [John]121-bold should put [his]121-bold arm round [[his]121-bold mistress]3834-his mistress 's waist , and say , ' Now having settled that , let [us]1283-us be [man]875-man and [wife]3836-wife , and all will end happily ! ' Why [him]122-mr. bold good nature should not be rewarded , when such reward would operate to the disadvantage of none , [Mary]162-mary , who had more sense than romance , could not understand ; and [she]162-mary said as much . [Eleanor]104-eleanor , however , was firm , and made quite an eloquent speech to support [her]104-eleanor own view of the question : [she]104-eleanor could not condescend , [she]104-eleanor said , to ask such a favour on any other terms than those proposed . [Mary]162-mary might , perhaps , think [her]104-eleanor high - flown , but [she]162-mary had [her]162-mary own ideas , and [she]162-mary could not submit to sacrifice [her]162-mary self - respect . "[0-i] But [I]0-i am sure [you]1284-you love him,—don't [you]1284-you ? " pleaded [Mary]162-mary ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i am sure [he]1285-him loves [you]1284-you better than anything in [the world]325-the world . " [Eleanor]104-eleanor was going to make another speech , but a tear came to each eye , and [she]104-eleanor could not ; so [she]104-eleanor pretended to blow [her]104-eleanor nose , and walked to the window , and made a little inward call on [her]104-eleanor own courage , and finding [herself]104-eleanor somewhat sustained , said sententiously , — "[0-i] [Mary]162-mary , this is nonsense . " "[0-i] But [you]1284-you do love [him]1285-him , " said [Mary]162-mary , who had followed [[her]162-mary friend]3830-her friend to the window , and now spoke with [her]162-mary arms close wound round [the other]762-the other 's waist . "[1284-you] [You]1284-you do love [him]1285-him with all [your]1284-you heart,—you know [you]1284-you do ; [I]0-i defy [you]1284-you to deny it . " "[0-i] [I]0-i " commenced [Eleanor]104-eleanor , turning sharply round to refute the charge ; but the intended falsehood stuck in [her]104-eleanor throat , and never came to utterance . [She]104-eleanor could not deny [her]104-eleanor love , so [she]104-eleanor took plentifully to tears , and leant upon [[her]104-eleanor friend]3830-her friend 's bosom and sobbed there , and protested that , love or no love , it would make no difference in [her]104-eleanor resolve , and called [Mary]162-mary , a thousand times , [the most cruel of [girls]3376-girls]3840-the most cruel of girls , and swore [her]162-mary to secrecy by a hundred oaths , and ended by declaring that [the girl who could betray [[her]104-eleanor friend]3830-her friend 's love , even to [a brother]3844-a brother , would be as black [a traitor]3845-a traitor as [a soldier in a garrison who should open the city gates to [the enemy]2840-the enemy]3846-a soldier in a garrison who should open the city gates to the enemy]3842-the girl who could betray her friend 's love , even to a brother , would be as black a traitor as a soldier in a garrison who should open the city gates to the enemy . While [they]3848-they were yet discussing the matter , [Bold]162-mary returned , and [Eleanor]104-eleanor was forced into sudden action : [she]104-eleanor had either to accomplish or abandon [her]104-eleanor plan ; and having slipped into [[[her]104-eleanor friend]3830-her friend 's bedroom]3850-her friend 's bedroom , as [the gentleman]3851-the gentleman closed the hall door , [she]104-eleanor washed the marks of tears from [her]104-eleanor eyes , and resolved within [herself]104-eleanor to go through with it . "[1287-him] Tell [him]1287-him [I]0-i am [here]904-here , " said [she]104-eleanor , "[0-i] and coming in ; and mind , whatever [you]1287-him do , do n't leave [us]1289-us . " So [Mary]162-mary informed [[her]162-mary brother]528-her brother , with a somewhat sombre air , that [Miss Harding]156-miss harding was in [the next room]3853-the next room , and was coming to speak to [him]1287-him . [Eleanor]104-eleanor was certainly thinking more of [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father than [herself]104-eleanor , as [she]104-eleanor arranged [her]104-eleanor hair before the glass , and removed the traces of sorrow from [her]104-eleanor face , and yet [I]1287-him should be untrue if [I]1287-him said that [she]104-eleanor was not anxious to appear well before [[her]104-eleanor lover]656-her lover : why else was [she]104-eleanor so sedulous with that stubborn curl that would rebel against [her]104-eleanor hand , and why did [she]104-eleanor smooth so eagerly [her]104-eleanor ruffled ribands ? why else did [she]104-eleanor damp [her]104-eleanor eyes to dispel the redness , and bite [her]104-eleanor pretty lips to bring back the colour ? Of course [she]104-eleanor was anxious to look [her]104-eleanor best , for [she]104-eleanor was but [a mortal angel]3856-a mortal angel after all . But had [she]104-eleanor been immortal , had [she]104-eleanor flitted back to [the sitting room]3857-the sitting room on a cherub 's wings , [she]104-eleanor could not have had a more faithful heart , or a truer wish to save [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father at any cost to [herself]104-eleanor . [John Bold]121-bold had not met [her]104-eleanor since the day when [she]104-eleanor left [him]121-bold in dudgeon in [the cathedral]258-the cathedral close . Since that [his]121-bold whole time had been occupied in promoting the cause against [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father , and not unsuccessfully . [He]121-bold had often thought of [her]104-eleanor , and turned over in [his]121-bold mind a hundred schemes for showing [her]104-eleanor how disinterested was [his]121-bold love . [He]121-bold would write to [her]104-eleanor and beseech [her]104-eleanor not to allow the performance of a public duty to injure [him]121-bold in [her]104-eleanor estimation ; [he]121-bold would write to [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding , explain all [his]121-bold views , and boldly claim [[the warden]318-the warden 's daughter]3862-the warden 's daughter , urging that the untoward circumstances between [them]3863-them need be no bar to [their]3863-them ancient friendship , or to a closer tie ; [he]121-bold would throw [himself]121-bold on [his]121-bold knees before [[his]121-bold mistress]3834-his mistress ; [he]121-bold would wait and marry [the daughter]3715-the daughter when [the father]3737-the father had lost [[his]3737-the father home]3867-his home and [his]3737-the father income ; [he]121-bold would give up the lawsuit and go to [Australia]39-australia , with [her]3715-the daughter of course , leaving [the Jupiter]3310-the jupiter and [Mr. Finney]131-finney to complete the case between [them]3863-them . Sometimes as [he]121-bold woke in the morning fevered and impatient , [he]121-bold would blow out [his]121-bold brains and have done with all [his]121-bold cares — but this idea was generally consequent on an imprudent supper enjoyed in company with [Tom Towers]190-tom towers . How beautiful [Eleanor]104-eleanor appeared to [him]121-bold as [she]104-eleanor slowly walked into [the room]3355-the room ! Not for nothing had all those little cares been taken . Though [[her]104-eleanor sister]3823-her sister , [[the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon 's wife]3872-the archdeacon 's wife , had spoken slightingly of [her]104-eleanor charms , [Eleanor]104-eleanor was very beautiful when seen aright . [Hers]104-eleanor was not of those impassive faces , which have the beauty of a marble bust ; finely chiselled features , perfect in every line , true to the rules of symmetry , as lovely to [a stranger]3873-a stranger as to [a friend]1011-a friend , unvarying unless in sickness , or as age affects [them]3863-them . [She]104-eleanor had no startling brilliancy of beauty , no pearly whiteness , no radiant carnation : [she]104-eleanor had not the majestic contour that rivets attention , demands instant wonder , and then disappoints by the coldness of its charms . [You]3875-you might pass [Eleanor Harding]104-eleanor in [the street]3876-the street without notice , but [you]3875-you could hardly pass an evening with [her]104-eleanor and not lose [your]3875-you heart . [She]104-eleanor had never appeared more lovely to [[her]104-eleanor lover]656-her lover than [she]104-eleanor now did . [Her]104-eleanor face was animated though it was serious , and [her]104-eleanor full dark lustrous eyes shone with anxious energy ; [her]104-eleanor hand trembled as [she]104-eleanor took [his]656-her lover , and [she]104-eleanor could hardly pronounce [his]656-her lover name , when [she]104-eleanor addressed [him]656-her lover . [Bold]121-bold wished with all [his]121-bold heart that the Australian scheme was in the act of realisation , and that [he]121-bold and [Eleanor]104-eleanor were away together , never to hear further of the lawsuit . [He]121-bold began to talk , asked after [her]104-eleanor health — said something about [London]13-london being very stupid , and more about [Barchester]6-barchester being very pleasant : declared the weather to be very hot , and then inquired after [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding . "[1287-him] [[My]0-i father]942-my father is not very well , " said [Eleanor]104-eleanor . [John Bold]121-bold was very sorry , so sorry : [he]121-bold hoped it was nothing serious , and put on the unmeaningly solemn face , which [people]1126-people usually use on such occasions . "[0-i] [I]0-i especially want to speak to [you]0-i about [[my]0-i father]942-my father , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold ; indeed , [I]0-i am now here on purpose to do so . [Papa]191-papa is very unhappy , very unhappy indeed , about this affair of [the hospital]364-the hospital : [you]0-i would pity [him]191-papa , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , if [you]0-i could see how wretched it has made [him]191-papa . " "[0-i] Oh [Miss Harding]156-miss harding ! " "[0-i] Indeed [you]0-i would,—any [one]729-one would pity [him]191-papa : but [a friend]1011-a friend , [an old friend]1295-an old friend as [you]0-i are — indeed [you]0-i would . [He]191-papa is [an altered man]1296-an altered man ; [his]191-papa cheerfulness has all gone , and [his]191-papa sweet temper , and [his]191-papa kind happy tone of voice ; [you]0-i would hardly know [him]191-papa if [you]0-i saw [him]191-papa , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , [he]191-papa is so much altered ; and — and — if this goes on , [he]191-papa will die . " Here [Eleanor]104-eleanor had recourse to [her]104-eleanor handkerchief , and so also had [[her]104-eleanor auditors]3879-her auditors ; but [she]104-eleanor plucked up [her]104-eleanor courage and went on with [her]104-eleanor tale . "[191-papa] [He]191-papa will break [his]191-papa heart , and die . [I]0-i am sure , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , it was not [you]122-mr. bold who wrote those cruel things in the newspaper — " [John Bold]121-bold eagerly protested that it was not , but [his]121-bold heart smote [him]121-bold as to [his]121-bold intimate alliance with [Tom Towers]190-tom towers . "[122-mr. bold] No , [I]0-i am sure it was not ; and [papa]2730-papa has not for a moment thought so ; [you]122-mr. bold would not be so cruel — but it has nearly killed [him]2730-papa . [Papa]191-papa can not bear to think that [people]1126-people should so speak of [him]191-papa , and that [every body]1299-every body should hear [him]191-papa so spoken of:—they have called [him]191-papa avaricious , and dishonest , and [they]1126-people say [he]191-papa is robbing [the old men]314-the old men , and taking the money of [the hospital]364-the hospital for nothing . " "[1126-people] [I]0-i have never said so , [Miss Harding]156-miss harding . [I]0-i — " "[0-i] No , " continued [Eleanor]104-eleanor , interrupting [him]122-mr. bold , for [she]104-eleanor was now in the full flood tide of [her]104-eleanor eloquence ; "[0-i] no , [I]0-i am sure [you]122-mr. bold have not , but [others]551-others have said so ; and if this goes on , if such things are written again , it will kill [papa]191-papa . Oh ! [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , if [you]122-mr. bold only knew the state [he]191-papa is in ! Now [papa]2730-papa does not care much about money . " Both [[her]104-eleanor auditors]3879-her auditors , [brother]3881-brother and [sister]3121-sister , assented to this , and declared on [their]3879-her auditors own knowledge that [no man]2761-no man lived less addicted to filthy lucre than [the warden]318-the warden . "[2730-papa] Oh ! it 's so kind of [you]122-mr. bold to say so , [Mary]162-mary , and of [you]122-mr. bold too , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold . [I]0-i could n't bear that [people]1126-people should think unjustly of [papa]2730-papa . Do [you]122-mr. bold know [he]2730-papa would give up [the hospital]364-the hospital altogether , only [he]2730-papa can not . [The archdeacon]382-the archdeacon says it would be cowardly , and that [he]2730-papa would be deserting [his]382-the archdeacon order , and injuring [the church]454-the church . Whatever may happen , [papa]2730-papa will not do that : [he]2730-papa would leave [the place]794-the place tomorrow willingly , and give up [[his]2730-papa house]660-his house , and the income and all , if [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon — " [Eleanor]104-eleanor was going to say "[382-the archdeacon] would let [him]2730-papa , " but [she]104-eleanor stopped [herself]104-eleanor before [she]104-eleanor had compromised [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father 's dignity ; and giving a long sigh , [she]104-eleanor added—"Oh[382-the archdeacon] , [I]0-i do so wish [he]2730-papa would . " "[1313-no one who knows mr. harding personally] [No one who knows [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding personally]1313-no one who knows mr. harding personally , accuses [him]102-mr. harding for a moment , " said [Bold]122-mr. bold . "[102-mr. harding] It is [he]102-mr. harding that has to bear the punishment ; it is [he]102-mr. harding that suffers , " said [Eleanor]104-eleanor ; "[102-mr. harding] and what for ? what has [he]102-mr. harding done wrong ? how has [he]102-mr. harding deserved this persecution ? [he]102-mr. harding that never had an unkind thought in [his]102-mr. harding life , [he]102-mr. harding that never said an unkind word ! " and here [she]104-eleanor broke down , and the violence of [her]104-eleanor sobs stopped [her]104-eleanor utterance . [Bold]122-mr. bold , for the fifth or sixth time , declared that neither [he]122-mr. bold nor [any of [[his]122-mr. bold friends]627-his friends]3886-any of his friends imputed any blame personally to [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding . "[102-mr. harding] Then why should [he]102-mr. harding be persecuted ? " ejaculated [Eleanor]104-eleanor through [her]104-eleanor tears , forgetting in [her]104-eleanor eagerness that [her]104-eleanor intention had been to humble [herself]104-eleanor as a suppliant before [John Bold—"why]194-john[122-mr. bold] should [he]102-mr. harding be singled out for scorn and disgrace ? why should [he]102-mr. harding be made so wretched ? Oh ! [Mr. Bold,"—and]195-mr. bold,"—and [she]104-eleanor turned towards [him]122-mr. bold as though the kneeling scene were about to be commenced—"oh[195-mr. bold,"—and] ! [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , why did [you]122-mr. bold begin all this ? [you]122-mr. bold whom [we]1314-we all so — so — valued ! " To speak the truth , [the reformer]2824-the reformer 's punishment was certainly come upon [him]122-mr. bold , for [his]122-mr. bold present plight was not enviable ; [he]122-mr. bold had nothing for it but to excuse [himself]122-mr. bold by platitudes about public duty , which it is by no means worth while to repeat , and to reiterate [his]122-mr. bold eulogy on [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding 's character . [His]122-mr. bold position was certainly a cruel one : had [any gentlemen]3889-any gentlemen called upon [him]122-mr. bold on behalf of [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding [he]122-mr. bold could of course have declined to enter upon the subject ; but how could [he]122-mr. bold do so with [a beautiful girl]3890-a beautiful girl , with [the daughter of [the man whom [he]122-mr. bold had injured , with [his]122-mr. bold own love]3892-the man whom he had injured , with his own love]3891-the daughter of the man whom he had injured , with his own love ? In the meantime [Eleanor]104-eleanor recollected [herself]104-eleanor , and again summoned up [her]104-eleanor energies . "[122-mr. bold] [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , " said [she]104-eleanor , "[122-mr. bold] [I]0-i have come here to implore [you]122-mr. bold to abandon this proceeding . " [He]122-mr. bold stood up from [his]122-mr. bold seat , and looked beyond measure distressed . "[0-i] To implore [you]0-i to abandon it , to implore [you]0-i to spare [[my]0-i father]942-my father , to spare either [his]942-my father life or [his]942-my father reason , for one or the other will pay the forfeit if this goes on . [I]0-i know how much [I]0-i am asking , and how little right [I]0-i have to ask anything ; but [I]0-i think [you]0-i will listen to [me]0-i as it is for [[my]0-i father]942-my father . Oh , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , pray , pray do this for [us]1317-us — pray do not drive to distraction a man who has loved [you]0-i so well . " [She]3893-she did not absolutely kneel to [him]122-mr. bold , but [she]3893-she followed [him]122-mr. bold as [he]122-mr. bold moved from [his]122-mr. bold chair , and laid [her]3893-she soft hands imploringly upon [his]122-mr. bold arm . Ah ! at any other time how exquisitely valuable would have been that touch ! but now [he]122-mr. bold was distraught , dumbfounded , and unmanned . What could [he]122-mr. bold say to that sweet suppliant ; how explain to [her]1318-her that the matter now was probably beyond [his]122-mr. bold control ; how tell [her]1318-her that [he]122-mr. bold could not quell the storm which [he]122-mr. bold had raised ? "[122-mr. bold] Surely , surely , [John]194-john , [you]194-john can not refuse [her]1318-her , " said [[his]122-mr. bold sister]536-his sister . "[194-john] [I]0-i would give [her]1318-her [my]0-i soul , " said [he]0-i , "[0-i] if it would serve [her]1318-her . " "[194-john] Oh , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold , " said [Eleanor]104-eleanor , "[122-mr. bold] do not speak so ; [I]0-i ask nothing for [myself]0-i ; and what [I]0-i ask for [[my]0-i father]942-my father , it can not harm [you]122-mr. bold to grant . " "[0-i] [I]0-i would give [her]1318-her [my]0-i soul , if it would serve [her]1318-her , " said [Bold]122-mr. bold , still addressing [[his]0-i sister]536-his sister ; "[1318-her] everything [I]0-i have is [hers]1318-her , if [she]1318-her will accept it ; [[my]0-i house]1320-my house , [my]0-i heart , [my]0-i all ; every hope of [my]0-i breast is centred in [her]1318-her : [her]1318-her smiles are sweeter to [me]0-i than the sun , and when [I]0-i see [her]1318-her in sorrow as [she]1318-her now is , every nerve in [my]0-i body suffers . [No man]2761-no man can love better than [I]0-i love [her]1318-her . " "[0-i] No , no , no , " ejaculated [Eleanor]104-eleanor , "[0-i] there can be no talk of love between [us]1322-us ; will [you]0-i protect [[my]0-i father]942-my father from the evil [you]0-i have brought upon [him]942-my father ? " "[104-eleanor] Oh , [Eleanor]104-eleanor , [I]0-i will do anything ; let [me]0-i tell [you]104-eleanor how [I]0-i love [you]104-eleanor ! " "[0-i] No , no , no , " [she]104-eleanor almost screamed ; "[0-i] this is unmanly of [you]0-i , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold . Will [you]0-i , will [you]0-i , will [you]0-i leave [[my]0-i father]942-my father to die in peace in [[his]942-my father quiet home]1325-his quiet home ? " and seizing [him]0-i by [his]0-i arm and hand , [she]104-eleanor followed [him]0-i across [the room]3355-the room towards the door . "[0-i] [I]0-i will not leave [you]0-i till [you]0-i promise [me]0-i ; [I]0-i 'll cling to [you]0-i in [the street]3876-the street ; [I]0-i 'll kneel to [you]0-i before [all the people]1327-all the people . [You]0-i shall promise [me]0-i this , [you]0-i shall promise [me]0-i this , [you]0-i shall — " And [she]1328-her clung to [him]0-i with fixed tenacity , and reiterated [her]1328-her resolve with hysterical passion . "[0-i] Speak to [her]1328-her , [John]194-john ; answer [her]1328-her , " said [Mary]162-mary , bewildered by the unexpected vehemence of [Eleanor]104-eleanor 's manner ; "[1328-her] [you]0-i can not have the cruelty to refuse [her]1328-her . " "[0-i] Promise [me]0-i , promise [me]0-i , " said [Eleanor;"say]196-eleanor;"say[0-i] that [[my]0-i father]942-my father is safe — one word will do . [I]0-i know how true [you]0-i are ; say one word , and [I]0-i will let [you]0-i go . " [She]1328-her still held [him]0-i , and looked eagerly into [his]0-i face , with [her]1328-her hair dishevelled , and [her]1328-her eyes all bloodshot . [She]1328-her had no thought now of [herself]1328-her , no care now for [her]1328-her appearance , and yet [he]0-i thought [he]0-i had never seen [her]1328-her half so lovely ; [he]0-i was amazed at the intensity of [her]1328-her beauty , and could hardly believe that it was [she]1328-her whom [he]0-i had dared to love . "[0-i] Promise [me]0-i , " said [she]1328-her ; "[0-i] [I]0-i will not leave [you]0-i till [you]0-i have promised [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i will , " said [he]0-i at length , "[0-i] [I]0-i do — all [I]0-i can do , [I]0-i will do . " "[159-god] Then may [God Almighty]159-god bless [you]0-i for ever and ever ! " said [Eleanor]104-eleanor ; and falling on [her]1328-her knees with [her]1328-her face on [Mary]162-mary 's lap , [she]1328-her wept and sobbed like [a child]2748-a child : [her]1328-her strength had carried [her]1328-her through [her]1328-her allotted task , but now it was well nigh exhausted . In a while [she]1328-her was partly recovered , and got up to go , and would have gone , had not [Bold]162-mary made [her]1328-her understand that it was necessary for [him]0-i to explain to [her]1328-her how far it was in [his]0-i power to put an end to the proceedings which had been taken against [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding . Had [he]0-i spoken on any other subject , [she]1328-her would have vanished , but on that [she]1328-her was bound to hear [him]0-i ; and now the danger of [her]1328-her position commenced . While [she]1328-her had an active part to play , while [she]1328-her clung to [him]0-i as a suppliant , it was easy enough for [her]1328-her to reject [his]0-i proffered love , and cast from [her]1328-her [his]0-i caressing words ; but now — now that [he]0-i had yielded , and was talking to [her]1328-her calmly and kindly as to [[her]1328-her father]293-her father 's welfare , it was hard enough for [her]1328-her to do so . Then [Mary Bold]162-mary assisted [her]1328-her , but now [she]1328-her was quite on [[her]1328-her brother]528-her brother 's side . [Mary]162-mary said but little , but every word [she]162-mary did say gave some direct and deadly blow . The first thing [she]1328-her did was to make room for [[her]1328-her brother]528-her brother between [herself]1328-her and [Eleanor]104-eleanor on the sofa : as the sofa was full large for three , [Eleanor]104-eleanor could not resent this , nor could [she]104-eleanor show suspicion by taking another seat ; but [she]104-eleanor felt it to be a most unkind proceeding . And then [Mary]162-mary would talk as though [they]3901-they three were joined in some close peculiar bond together ; as though [they]3901-they were in future always to wish together , contrive together , and act together ; and [Eleanor]104-eleanor could not gainsay this ; [she]104-eleanor could not make another speech , and say , "[122-mr. bold] [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold and [I]0-i are [mere strangers]1330-mere strangers , [Mary]162-mary , and are always to remain so ! " [He]528-her brother explained to [her]162-mary that , though undoubtedly the proceeding against [the hospital]364-the hospital had commenced solely with [himself]528-her brother , many others were now interested in the matter , [some of whom were much more influential than [himself]528-her brother]3903-some of whom were much more influential than himself : that it was to [him]528-her brother alone , however , that [the lawyers]3904-the lawyers looked for instruction as to [their]3904-the lawyers doings , and , more important still , for the payment of [their]3904-the lawyers bills ; and [he]528-her brother promised that [he]528-her brother would at once give [them]3904-the lawyers notice that it was [his]528-her brother intention to abandon the cause . [He]528-her brother thought , [he]528-her brother said , that it was not probable that any active steps would be taken after [he]528-her brother had seceded from the matter , though it was possible that some passing allusion might still be made to [the hospital]364-the hospital in the daily Jupiter . [He]528-her brother promised , however , that [he]528-her brother would use [his]528-her brother best influence to prevent any further personal allusion being made to [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding . [He]528-her brother then suggested that [he]528-her brother would on that afternoon ride over [himself]528-her brother to [Dr. Grantly]106-dr. grantly , and inform [him]106-dr. grantly of [his]528-her brother altered intentions on the subject , and with this view , [he]528-her brother postponed [his]528-her brother immediate return to [London]13-london . This was all very pleasant , and [Eleanor]104-eleanor did enjoy a sort of triumph in the feeling that [she]104-eleanor had attained the object for which [she]104-eleanor had sought this interview ; but still the part of Iphigenia was to be played out . [The gods]3906-the gods had heard [her]104-eleanor prayer , granted [her]104-eleanor request , and were [they]3906-the gods not to have [their]3906-the gods promised sacrifice ? [Eleanor]104-eleanor was not a girl to defraud [them]3906-the gods wilfully ; so , as soon as [she]104-eleanor decently could , [she]104-eleanor got up for [her]104-eleanor bonnet . "[0-i] Are [you]1331-you going so soon ? " said [Bold]122-mr. bold , who half - an - hour since would have given a hundred pounds that [he]122-mr. bold was in [London]13-london , and [she]104-eleanor still at [Barchester]6-barchester . "[1331-you] Oh yes ! " said [she]104-eleanor . "[1331-you] [I]0-i am so much obliged to [you]1331-you ; [papa]2730-papa will feel this to be so kind " ( [she]104-eleanor did not , quite appreciate all [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father 's feelings ) ; "[2730-papa] of course [I]0-i must tell [him]2730-papa , and [I]0-i will say that [you]1331-you will see [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon . " "[0-i] But may [I]0-i not say one word for [myself]0-i ? " said [Bold]122-mr. bold . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll fetch [you]1331-you [your]1331-you bonnet , [Eleanor]104-eleanor , " said [Mary]162-mary , in the act of leaving [the room]3355-the room . "[162-mary] [Mary]162-mary , [Mary]162-mary , " said [she]162-mary , getting up and catching [her]162-mary by [her]162-mary dress , "[0-i] do n't go , [I]0-i 'll get [my]0-i bonnet [myself]0-i ; " but [Mary]162-mary , [the traitress]3909-the traitress , stood fast by the door , and permitted no such retreat . [Poor Iphigenia]197-poor iphigenia ! And with a volley of impassioned love , [John Bold]121-bold poured forth the feelings of [his]121-bold heart , swearing , as [men]453-men do , some truths and many falsehoods ; and [Eleanor]104-eleanor repeated with every shade of vehemence the "[0-i] No , no , no , " which had had a short time since so much effect ; but now , alas ! its strength was gone . Let [her]104-eleanor be never so vehement , [her]104-eleanor vehemence was not respected ; all [her]104-eleanor "[0-i] No , no , no 's " were met with counter asseverations , and at last were overpowered . The ground was cut from under [her]104-eleanor on every side : [she]104-eleanor was pressed to say whether [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father would object ; whether [she]104-eleanor [herself]104-eleanor had any aversion ( aversion ! God help [her]104-eleanor , [poor girl]3912-poor girl ! the word nearly made [her]104-eleanor jump into [his]293-her father arms ) ; any other preference ( this [she]104-eleanor loudly disclaimed ) ; whether it was impossible that [she]104-eleanor should love [him]293-her father ( [Eleanor]104-eleanor could not say that it was impossible ): and so at last , all [her]104-eleanor defences demolished , all [her]104-eleanor maiden barriers swept away , [she]104-eleanor capitulated , or rather marched out with the honours of war , vanquished evidently , palpably vanquished , but still not reduced to the necessity of confessing it . And so the altar on [the shore of [the modern Aulis]3914-the modern aulis]3913-the shore of the modern aulis reeked with no sacrifice . Whether or no the ill - natured prediction made by [certain ladies]3915-certain ladies in the beginning of the last chapter , was or was not carried out to the letter , [I]0-i am not in a position to state ; [Eleanor]104-eleanor , however , certainly did feel [herself]104-eleanor to have been baffled , as [she]104-eleanor returned [home]3108-home with all [her]104-eleanor news to [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father . Certainly [she]104-eleanor had been victorious , certainly [she]104-eleanor had achieved [her]104-eleanor object , certainly [she]104-eleanor was not unhappy , and yet [she]104-eleanor did not feel [herself]104-eleanor triumphant . Everything would run smooth now . [Eleanor]104-eleanor was not at all addicted to [the Lydian school of romance]3918-the lydian school of romance ; [she]104-eleanor by no means objected to [[her]104-eleanor lover]656-her lover because [he]656-her lover came in at the door under the name of [Absolute]198-absolute , instead of pulling [her]104-eleanor out of a window under the name of [Beverley]199-beverley ; and yet [she]104-eleanor felt that [she]104-eleanor had been imposed upon , and could hardly think of [Mary Bold]162-mary with sisterly charity . "[0-i] [I]0-i did think [I]0-i could have trusted [Mary]162-mary , " [she]104-eleanor said to [herself]104-eleanor over and over again . "[162-mary] Oh that [she]162-mary should have dared to keep [me]0-i in [the room]3355-the room when [I]0-i tried to get out ! " [Eleanor]104-eleanor , however , felt that the game was up , and that [she]104-eleanor had now nothing further to do , but to add to the budget of news which was prepared for [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father , that [John Bold]121-bold was [[her]104-eleanor accepted lover]3921-her accepted lover . [We]3922-we will , however , now leave [her]104-eleanor on [her]104-eleanor way , and go with [John Bold]121-bold to [Plumstead Episcopi]32-plumstead episcopi , merely premising that [Eleanor]104-eleanor on reaching [home]3108-home will not find things so smooth as [she]104-eleanor fondly expected ; [two messengers]3924-two messengers had come , one to [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father , and the other to [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon , and each of [them]3924-two messengers much opposed to [her]104-eleanor quiet mode of solving all [their]3924-two messengers difficulties ; the one in the shape of a number of [the Jupiter]3310-the jupiter , and the other in that of a further opinion from [Sir Abraham Haphazard]151-sir abraham . [John Bold]121-bold got on [his]121-bold horse and rode off to [Plumstead Episcopi]32-plumstead episcopi ; not briskly and with eager spur , as [men]453-men do ride when self - satisfied with [their]453-men own intentions , but slowly , modestly , thoughtfully , and somewhat in dread of the coming interview . Now and again [he]121-bold would recur to the scene which was just over , support [himself]121-bold by the remembrance of the silence that gives consent , and exult as [a happy lover]3929-a happy lover ; but even this feeling was not without a shade of remorse . Had [he]121-bold not shown [himself]121-bold childishly weak thus to yield up the resolve of many hours of thought to the tears of [a pretty girl]3930-a pretty girl ? How was [he]121-bold to meet [[his]121-bold lawyer]693-his lawyer ? How was [he]121-bold to back out of a matter in which [his]121-bold name was already so publicly concerned ? What , oh what ! was [he]121-bold to say to [Tom Towers]190-tom towers ? While meditating these painful things [he]121-bold reached [the lodge leading up to [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon 's glebe]3932-the lodge leading up to the archdeacon 's glebe , and for the first time in [his]121-bold life found [himself]121-bold within [the sacred precincts]3934-the sacred precincts . [[All the doctor]3935-all the doctor 's children]3936-all the doctor 's children were together on the slope of [the lawn close to [the road]3938-the road]3937-the lawn close to the road , as [Bold]121-bold rode up to [the hall]3939-the hall door . [They]3936-all the doctor 's children were there holding high debate on matters evidently of deep interest at [Plumstead Episcopi]32-plumstead episcopi , and the voices of [the boys]3382-the boys had been heard before [the lodge]3941-the lodge gate was closed . [Florinda]180-florinda and [Grizzel]181-grizzel , frightened at the sight of so well - known [an enemy to [the family]3943-the family]3942-an enemy to the family , fled on the first appearance of [the horseman]3944-the horseman , and ran in terror to [[their]3382-the boys mother]3431-their mother 's arms ; not for [them]3936-all the doctor 's children was it , tender branches , to resent injuries , or as [members of [a church]3947-a church]3946-members of a church militant to put on armour against [its enemies]3545-its enemies : but [the boys]3382-the boys stood [their]3382-the boys ground like [heroes]3950-heroes , and boldly demanded the business of [the intruder]3951-the intruder . "[162-mary] Do [you]1335-you want to see [anybody here]1336-anybody here , [sir]1337-sir ? " said [Henry]116-henry , with a defiant eye and a hostile tone , which plainly said that at any rate [no one there]3952-no one there wanted to see [the person so addressed]3953-the person so addressed ; and as [he]116-henry spoke [he]116-henry brandished aloft [his]116-henry garden water - pot , holding it by the spout , ready for the braining of any one . [Samuel]179-samuel stayed till [the servant]3024-the servant came , chatting and patting the horse ; but as soon as [Bold]122-mr. bold had disappeared through the front door , [he]122-mr. bold stuck a switch under the animal 's tail to make [him]122-mr. bold kick , if possible . [The church]454-the church reformer soon found [himself]122-mr. bold tête à tête with [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon in [that same room]3961-that same room , in [that sanctum sanctorum of [the rectory]3464-the rectory]3962-that sanctum sanctorum of the rectory , to which [we]1347-lads have already been introduced . As [he]122-mr. bold entered [he]122-mr. bold heard the click of a certain patent lock , but it struck [him]122-mr. bold with no surprise : [the worthy clergyman]3964-the worthy clergyman was no doubt hiding from eyes profane [his]122-mr. bold last much - studied sermon , for [the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon , though [he]382-the archdeacon preached but seldom , was famous for [his]382-the archdeacon sermons . [No room]3966-no room , [Bold]122-mr. bold thought , could have been more becoming for [a dignitary of [the church]454-the church]3967-a dignitary of the church ; each wall was loaded with theology ; over each separate book - case was printed in small gold letters the names of [those great divines whose works were ranged beneath]3969-those great divines whose works were ranged beneath : beginning from [the early fathers]3970-the early fathers in due chronological order , there were to be found the precious labours of [the chosen servants of [the church]454-the church]3971-the chosen servants of the church down to the last pamphlet written in opposition to the consecration of [Dr. Hampden]201-dr. hampden ; and raised above this were to be seen the busts of the greatest among [the great]3973-the great : Chrysostom , [St. Augustine]202-st. augustine , [Thomas à Becket]203-thomas à becket , [Cardinal Wolsey]204-cardinal wolsey , [Archbishop Laud]205-archbishop laud , and [Dr. Philpotts]206-dr. philpotts . Every appliance that could make study pleasant and give ease to the over - toiled brain was there : chairs made to relieve each limb and muscle ; reading - desks and writing - desks to suit every attitude ; lamps and candles mechanically contrived to throw their light on any favoured spot , as [the student]3974-the student might desire ; a shoal of newspapers to amuse the few leisure moments which might be stolen from the labours of the day ; and then from the window a view right through a bosky vista along which ran a broad green path from [the rectory]3464-the rectory to [the church]454-the church , at the end of which [the tawny - tinted fine old tower]3977-the tawny - tinted fine old tower was seen with all [its]3977-the tawny - tinted fine old tower variegated pinnacles and parapets . [Few parish churches in [England]14-england]3978-few parish churches in england are in better repair , or better worth keeping so , than that at [Plumstead Episcopi]32-plumstead episcopi ; and yet [it]454-the church is built in a faulty style : the body of [the church]454-the church is low — so low , that the nearly flat leaden roof would be visible from [the churchyard]3980-the churchyard , were it not for the carved parapet with which [it]454-the church is surrounded . [It]454-the church is cruciform , though the transepts are irregular , one being larger than the other ; and [the tower]3981-the tower is much too high in proportion to [the church]454-the church : but the colour of [the building]403-the building is perfect ; it is that rich yellow grey which one finds nowhere but in the south and west of [England]14-england , and which is so strong a characteristic of most of [[our]3984-our old houses of Tudor architecture]3985-our old houses of tudor architecture . The stone work also is beautiful ; the mullions of the windows and the thick tracery of the Gothic workmanship is as rich as fancy can desire ; and though in gazing on [such a structure]3986-such a structure , one knows by rule that [the old priests who built it]3987-the old priests who built it , built [it]454-the church wrong , one can not bring [oneself]3988-oneself to wish that [they]3987-the old priests who built it should have made [it]454-the church other than [it]454-the church is . As [he]613-the doctor got on [his]613-the doctor horse , which [he]613-the doctor was fain to do feeling like a dog turned out of [a kitchen]4001-a kitchen , [he]613-the doctor was again greeted by [little Sammy]179-samuel . "[122-mr. bold] Good bye , [Mr. Bold]122-mr. bold ; [I]0-i hope [we]1395-we may have the pleasure of seeing [you]0-i again before long ; [I]0-i am sure [papa]2730-papa will always be glad to see [you]0-i . " That was certainly the bitterest moment in [John Bold]121-bold 's life ; not even the remembrance of [his]613-the doctor successful love could comfort [him]613-the doctor ; nay , when [he]613-the doctor thought of [Eleanor]200-eleanor , [he]613-the doctor felt that it was that very love which had brought [him]613-the doctor to such a pass . That [he]613-the doctor should have been so insulted , and be unable to reply ! That [he]613-the doctor should have given up so much to the request of [a girl]568-a girl , and then have had [his]613-the doctor motives so misunderstood ! That [he]613-the doctor should have made so gross a mistake as this visit of [his]613-the doctor to [[the archdeacon]382-the archdeacon 's]4004-the archdeacon 's ! [He]613-the doctor bit the top of [his]613-the doctor whip , till [he]613-the doctor penetrated the horn of which it was made : [he]613-the doctor struck the poor animal in [his]613-the doctor anger , and then was doubly angry with [himself]613-the doctor at [his]613-the doctor futile passion . [He]613-the doctor had been so completely check - mated , so palpably overcome ! and what was [he]613-the doctor to do ? [He]613-the doctor could not continue [his]613-the doctor action after pledging [himself]613-the doctor to abandon it ; nor was there any revenge in that — it was the very step to which [[his]613-the doctor enemy]639-his enemy had endeavoured to goad [him]613-the doctor ! The meeting between [Eleanor]200-eleanor and [[her]200-eleanor father]293-her father was not so stormy as that described in the last chapter , but it was hardly more successful . "[1407-we] [We]1407-we alluded some few weeks since to an instance of similar injustice , though in a more humble scale , in which [the warden of [an almshouse at [Barchester]6-barchester]1409-an almshouse at barchester]1408-the warden of an almshouse at barchester has become possessed of the income of the greater part of [the whole institution]1410-the whole institution . Why [an almshouse]1411-an almshouse should have [a warden]303-a warden [we]1407-we can not pretend to explain , nor can [we]1407-we say what special need [twelve old men]412-twelve old men can have for the services of [a separate clergyman]1414-a separate clergyman , seeing that [they]412-twelve old men have twelve reserved seats for [themselves]412-twelve old men in [Barchester Cathedral]8-barchester cathedral . " The case is certainly a paltry one after the tens of thousands with which [we]1423-we have been dealing , for [the warden]318-the warden 's income is after all but a poor eight hundred a year : eight hundred a year is not magnificent preferment of itself , and [the warden]318-the warden may , for anything [we]1423-we know , be worth much more to [the church]454-the church ; but if so , let [the church]454-the church pay [him]318-the warden out of funds justly at [its]454-the church own disposal . "[1423-we] [We]1423-we allude to the question of [the Barchester almshouse]1424-the barchester almshouse at the present moment , because [we]1423-we understand that a plea has been set up which will be peculiarly revolting to the minds of [English churchmen]1425-english churchmen . An action has been taken against [Mr. warden Harding]102-mr. harding , on behalf of [the almsmen]1426-the almsmen , by [a gentleman acting solely on public grounds]1427-a gentleman acting solely on public grounds , and it is to be argued that [Mr. Harding]102-mr. harding takes nothing but what [he]102-mr. harding receives as [a servant of [the hospital]364-the hospital]1428-a servant of the hospital , and that [he]102-mr. harding is not [himself]102-mr. harding responsible for the amount of stipend given to [him]102-mr. harding for [his]102-mr. harding work . Such a plea would doubtless be fair , if [any one]431-any one questioned the daily wages of [a bricklayer employed on [the building]403-the building]1431-a bricklayer employed on the building , or the fee of [the charwoman who cleans it]1433-the charwoman who cleans it ; but [we]1423-we can not envy the feeling of [a clergyman of [the Church of England]40-the church of england who could allow such an argument to be put into [his]102-mr. harding mouth]1434-a clergyman of the church of england who could allow such an argument to be put into his mouth . "[293-her father] [Poor Eleanor]104-eleanor ! this was hard upon [her]200-eleanor . Was it for this [she]200-eleanor had made [her]200-eleanor great resolve ! [One]729-one may work and not for thanks , but yet feel hurt at not receiving them ; and so it was with [Eleanor]104-eleanor : [one]729-one may be disinterested in [one]729-one 's good actions , and yet feel discontented that they are not recognised . [Eleanor]104-eleanor had had no wish to burden [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father with a weight of obligation , and yet [she]104-eleanor had looked forward to much delight from the knowledge that [she]104-eleanor had freed [him]293-her father from [his]293-her father sorrows : now such hopes were entirely over ; all that [she]104-eleanor had done was of no avail ; [she]104-eleanor had humbled [herself]104-eleanor to Bold in vain ; the evil was utterly beyond [her]104-eleanor power to cure ! [Eleanor]104-eleanor assured [[her]104-eleanor father]293-her father that as far as [she]104-eleanor was concerned , [she]104-eleanor could leave [[her]104-eleanor house]1479-her house and [her]104-eleanor ponies without a single regret : [she]104-eleanor was only so happy that [he]293-her father was going,—going where [he]293-her father would escape all this dreadful turmoil . " But [we]1480-they will take the music , [[my]104-eleanor dear]2725-my dear . Wretched in spirit , groaning under the feeling of insult , self - condemning , and ill - satisfied in every way , [Bold]122-mr. bold returned to [[his]122-mr. bold [London]13-london lodgings]1494-his london lodgings . [The attorneys whom [he]122-mr. bold had employed in [London]13-london]1496-the attorneys whom he had employed in london received [his]122-mr. bold instructions with surprise and evident misgiving : however , [they]1496-the attorneys whom he had employed in london could only obey , and mutter something of [their]1496-the attorneys whom he had employed in london sorrow that such heavy costs should only fall upon [[their]1496-the attorneys whom he had employed in london own employer]1497-their own employer , — especially as nothing was wanting but perseverance to throw [them]1496-the attorneys whom he had employed in london on the opposite party . [He]122-mr. bold next thought of the newspapers . The case had been taken up by more than one ; and [he]122-mr. bold was well aware that the key note had been sounded by [the Jupiter]3310-the jupiter . [He]122-mr. bold had been very intimate with [Tom Towers]190-tom towers , and had often discussed with [him]190-tom towers the affairs of [the hospital]364-the hospital . [Bold]122-mr. bold could not say that the articles in that paper had been written at [his]122-mr. bold own instigation ; [he]122-mr. bold did not even know as a fact that they had been written by [[his]122-mr. bold friend]285-his friend . [Tom Towers]190-tom towers had never said that such a view of the case , or such a side in the dispute , would be taken by the paper with which [he]190-tom towers was connected . Very discreet in such matters was [Tom Towers]190-tom towers , and altogether indisposed to talk loosely of the concerns of that mighty engine of which it was [his]190-tom towers high privilege to move in secret some portion . Nevertheless , [Bold]122-mr. bold believed that to [him]190-tom towers were owing those dreadful words which had caused such panic at [Barchester,—and]51-barchester,—and [he]122-mr. bold conceived [himself]122-mr. bold bound to prevent their repetition . With this view [he]122-mr. bold betook [himself]122-mr. bold from the attorneys ' to [that laboratory where , with amazing chemistry , [Tom Towers compounded thunderbolts for the destruction of all that is evil]1504-tom towers compounded thunderbolts for the destruction of all that is evil , and for the furtherance of all that is good , in this and other hemispheres]1503-that laboratory where , with amazing chemistry , tom towers compounded thunderbolts for the destruction of all that is evil , and for the furtherance of all that is good , in this and other hemispheres . Who has not heard of [Mount Olympus]52-mount olympus — that high abode of all the powers of type , [that favoured seat of [the great goddess [Pica]53-pica]1506-the great goddess pica , [that wondrous habitation of gods and devils]1507-that wondrous habitation of gods and devils , from whence , with ceaseless hum of steam and never - ending flow of Castalian ink]1505-that favoured seat of the great goddess pica , that wondrous habitation of gods and devils , from whence , with ceaseless hum of steam and never - ending flow of castalian ink , issue forth fifty thousand nightly edicts for the governance of [a subject nation]1508-a subject nation ? Velvet and gilding do not make a throne , nor gold and jewels a sceptre . It is a throne because [the most exalted one]1509-the most exalted one sits there — and a sceptre because [the most mighty one]1510-the most mighty one wields it . So it is with [Mount Olympus]52-mount olympus . Should [a stranger]3873-a stranger make [his]3873-a stranger way thither at dull noonday , or during the sleepy hours of the silent afternoon , [he]3873-a stranger would find [no acknowledged temple of power and beauty]1512-no acknowledged temple of power and beauty , no fitting fane for [the great Thunderer]1513-the great thunderer , no proud facades and pillared roofs to support the dignity of [this greatest of earthly potentates]1514-this greatest of earthly potentates . [It]52-mount olympus stands alone , as [it]52-mount olympus were , in [a mighty city]1516-a mighty city , close to the densest throng of [men]453-men , but partaking neither of the noise nor [the crowd]1518-the crowd ; [a small secluded , dreary spot , tenanted , one would say , by quite unambitious people at the easiest rents]1519-a small secluded , dreary spot , tenanted , one would say , by quite unambitious people at the easiest rents . ' Oh heavens ! and this is [Mount Olympus]52-mount olympus ! It is a fact amazing to [ordinary mortals]1545-ordinary mortals that [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter is never wrong . [They]1549-their hold council together and with anxious thought painfully elaborate [[their]1549-their country]1555-their country 's good ; but when all is done , [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter declares that all is nought . Does not [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter , coming forth daily with fifty thousand impressions full of unerring decision on every mortal subject , set all matters sufficiently at rest ? Is not [Tom Towers]190-tom towers here , able to guide [us]1546-our and willing ? It was here that [Tom Towers]190-tom towers lived , and cultivated with eminent success the tenth Muse who now governs the periodical press . But let it not be supposed that [[his]190-tom towers chambers]1667-his chambers were such , or so comfortless , as are frequently the gaunt abodes of [legal aspirants]1668-legal aspirants . Four chairs , a half - filled deal book - case with hangings of dingy green baize , an old office table covered with dusty papers , which are not moved once in six months , and [an older Pembroke brother with rickety legs , for all daily uses]1669-an older pembroke brother with rickety legs , for all daily uses — a despatcher for the preparation of lobsters and coffee , and an apparatus for the cooking of toast and mutton chops ; such utensils and luxuries as these did not suffice for the well being of [Tom Towers]190-tom towers . [He]190-tom towers indulged in [four rooms on the first floor]1670-four rooms on the first floor , [each of which]1671-each of which was furnished , if not with the splendour , with probably more than the comfort of [Stafford House]71-stafford house . Every addition that science and art have lately made to the luxuries of modern life was to be found [there]713-there . [The room in which [he]190-tom towers usually sat]1673-the room in which he usually sat was surrounded by book - shelves carefully filled ; nor was there a volume there which was not entitled to [its]1674-its place in such a collection , both by its intrinsic worth and exterior splendour : a pretty portable set of steps in one corner of [the room]3355-the room showed that those even on the higher shelves were intended for use . [The chamber]1676-the chamber contained but two works of art — the one , an admirable bust of [Sir Robert Peel , by Power]213-sir robert peel , by power , declared the individual politics of [[our]1677-our friend]996-our friend ; and the other , a singularly long figure of [a female devotee]1679-a female devotee , by [Millais]214-millais , told equally plainly [the school of art to which [he]190-tom towers was addicted]1680-the school of art to which he was addicted . This picture was not hung , as pictures usually are , against the wall ; there was no inch of wall vacant for such a purpose : [it]1681-it had a stand or desk erected for [its]1681-it own accommodation ; and there on [her]1679-a female devotee pedestal , framed and glazed , stood [the devotional lady]1682-the devotional lady looking intently at a lily as [no lady]1683-no lady ever looked before . [[Our]1677-our modern artists , whom [we]1677-our style [Præ - Raffaellites]215-præ - raffaellites]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites , have delighted to go back , not only to the finish and peculiar manner , but also to the subjects of [the early painters]1685-the early painters . It is impossible to give [them]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites too much praise for the elaborate perseverance with which [they]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites have equalled the minute perfections of [the masters from whom [they]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites take [their]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites inspiration]1686-the masters from whom they take their inspiration : nothing probably can exceed the painting of some of these latter - day pictures . It is , however , singular into what faults [they]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites fall as regards [[their]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites subjects]1687-their subjects : [they]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites are not quite content to take [the old stock groups]1688-the old stock groups — a [Sebastian]216-sebastian with [his]216-sebastian arrows , [a [Lucia]217-lucia with [her]217-lucia eyes in a dish , [a Lorenzo with a gridiron]1690-a lorenzo with a gridiron , or [the virgin]1691-the virgin with [two children]3771-two children]1689-a lucia with her eyes in a dish , a lorenzo with a gridiron , or the virgin with two children . But [they]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites are anything but happy in [their]1684-our modern artists , whom we style præ - raffaellites change . As a rule , [no figure]1693-no figure should be drawn in a position which it is impossible to suppose [any figure]1694-any figure should maintain . The patient endurance of [St. Sebastian]216-sebastian , the wild ecstacy of [St. John]218-st. john in [the Wilderness]72-the wilderness , the maternal love of [the virgin]1691-the virgin , are feelings naturally portrayed by a fixed posture ; but [the lady with the stiff back and bent neck]1696-the lady with the stiff back and bent neck , who looks at [her]1696-the lady with the stiff back and bent neck flower , and is still looking from hour to hour , gives [us]1697-us an idea of pain without grace , and abstraction without a cause . It was easy , from [[his]216-sebastian rooms]1698-his rooms , to see that [Tom Towers]190-tom towers was [a Sybarite]1699-a sybarite , though by no means [an idle one]1700-an idle one . [He]190-tom towers was lingering over [his]190-tom towers last cup of tea , surrounded by an ocean of newspapers , through which [he]190-tom towers had been swimming , when [John Bold]121-bold 's card was brought in by [[his]190-tom towers tiger]1701-his tiger . [This tiger]1702-this tiger never knew that [[his]1702-this tiger master]1703-his master was at [home]3108-home , though [he]1702-this tiger often knew that [he]1702-this tiger was not , and thus [Tom Towers]190-tom towers was never invaded but by [his]190-tom towers own consent . On this occasion , after twisting the card twice in [his]216-sebastian fingers , [he]190-tom towers signified to [[his]190-tom towers attendant]1705-his attendant imp that [he]190-tom towers was visible ; and the inner door was unbolted , and [[our]1706-our friend]996-our friend announced . [I]0-i have before said that [he]1708-he of [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter and [John Bold]121-bold were intimate . There was no very great difference in [their]1709-their ages , for [Towers]190-tom towers was still considerably under forty ; and when [Bold]121-bold had been attending [the [London]13-london hospitals]523-the london hospitals , [Towers]190-tom towers , who was not then [the great man that [he]121-bold had since become]1711-the great man that he had since become , had been much with [him]121-bold . Then [they]1709-their had often discussed together the objects of [their]1709-their ambition and future prospects ; then [Tom Towers]190-tom towers was struggling hard to maintain [himself]190-tom towers , as [a briefless barrister]1712-a briefless barrister , by short - hand reporting for any of the papers that would engage [him]190-tom towers ; then [he]190-tom towers had not dared to dream of writing leaders for [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter , or canvassing the conduct of [Cabinet ministers]1713-cabinet ministers . Things had altered since that time : [the briefless barrister]1714-the briefless barrister was still briefless , but [he]190-tom towers now despised briefs : could [he]190-tom towers have been sure of [a judge]1715-a judge 's seat , [he]190-tom towers would hardly have left [his]190-tom towers present career . It is true [he]190-tom towers wore no ermine , bore no outward marks of [a world]1631-a world 's respect ; but with what a load of inward importance was [he]190-tom towers charged ! It is true [his]190-tom towers name appeared in no large capitals ; on no wall was chalked up " [Tom Towers]190-tom towers for ever"—"Freedom[121-bold] of the Press and [Tom Towers]190-tom towers : " but what [member of Parliament]4087-member of parliament had half [his]4087-member of parliament power ? It is true that in far - off [provinces]73-provinces [men]453-men did not talk daily of [Tom Towers]190-tom towers , but [they]453-men read [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter , and acknowledged that without the [Jupiter]171-the jupiter life was not worth having . This kind of hidden but still conscious glory suited the nature of [the man]3682-the man . [He]190-tom towers loved to sit silent in a corner of [[his]190-tom towers club]4090-his club and listen to the loud chattering of [politicians]4091-politicians , and to think how [they]4091-politicians all were in [his]190-tom towers power — how [he]190-tom towers could smite the loudest of [them]4091-politicians , were it worth [his]190-tom towers while to raise [his]190-tom towers pen for such a purpose . [He]190-tom towers loved to watch [the great men of whom [he]190-tom towers daily wrote]4092-the great men of whom he daily wrote , and flatter [himself]190-tom towers that [he]190-tom towers was greater than any of [them]4092-the great men of whom he daily wrote . Each of [them]4092-the great men of whom he daily wrote was responsible to [[his]190-tom towers country]4093-his country , each of [them]4092-the great men of whom he daily wrote must answer if inquired into , each of [them]4092-the great men of whom he daily wrote must endure abuse with good humour , and insolence without anger . But to whom was [he]190-tom towers , [Tom Towers]190-tom towers , responsible ? [No one]283-no one could insult [him]190-tom towers ; [no one]283-no one could inquire into [him]190-tom towers . [He]190-tom towers could speak out withering words , and [no one]283-no one could answer [him]190-tom towers : [ministers]4097-ministers courted [him]190-tom towers , though perhaps [they]4097-ministers knew not [his]190-tom towers name ; [bishops]338-bishops feared [him]190-tom towers ; [judges]4099-judges doubted [their]4099-judges own verdicts unless [he]190-tom towers confirmed [them]4099-judges ; and [generals]4100-generals , in [their]4100-generals councils of war , did not consider more deeply what [the enemy]2840-the enemy would do , than what [the Jupiter]3310-the jupiter would say . [Tom Towers]190-tom towers never boasted of [the Jupiter]171-the jupiter ; [he]190-tom towers scarcely ever named the paper even to [the most intimate of [[his]190-tom towers friends]627-his friends]4103-the most intimate of his friends ; [he]190-tom towers did not even wish to be spoken of as connected with it ; but [he]190-tom towers did not the less value [his]190-tom towers privileges , or think the less of [his]190-tom towers own importance .
